questions.question_text: A project team is ready to start working on a project; however, the project manager says the work needs to be planned first. Which of the following is MOST likely to be produced during the first planning workshop?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
During the first planning workshop, the project team will work together to develop a plan for the project. One of the first steps in this process is typically to develop a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), which is a hierarchical decomposition of the project into smaller, more manageable components.

The WBS provides a framework for organizing the project work, and it can help the team to identify the major deliverables and activities that will be required to complete the project. It is often used as a basis for developing the project schedule, budget, and other project management plans.

Therefore, the most likely output from the first planning workshop would be the WBS. The other options, such as the Gantt chart, RACI, and risk register, are all important project management tools that will be developed later in the planning process, once the WBS and other key project plans are in place.

Selected Answer: C
A work breakdown structure (WBS) is most likely to be produced during the first planning workshop

questions.question_text: During a project, the project manager realizes some staff positions may be eliminated. Which of the following is the best NEXT step for the project manager to take?

choices.D: Add the risk to the risk register.
choices.A: Communicate the concern with the project sponsor.
choices.C: Review and update the project schedule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Add the risk to the risk register.

The potential elimination of staff positions is a risk to the project, and therefore, it should be added to the risk register. This will allow the project manager to assess the likelihood and impact of the risk and develop a risk response plan if necessary. Once the risk has been added to the risk register, the project manager may then communicate the concern with the project sponsor, identify replacement resources, and review and update the project schedule as needed.

Selected Answer: A
The best next step for the project manager to take is to communicate the concern with the project sponsor. The project sponsor is responsible for providing the necessary resources and support for the project and should be informed about any potential changes to the project that may impact staffing. The project manager should explain the situation to the project sponsor and discuss the potential impact on the project. Together, they can determine the best course of action and make any necessary adjustments to the project plan. Other steps, such as identifying replacement resources, reviewing and updating the project schedule, and adding the risk to the risk register, may also be necessary, but communicating with the project sponsor should be the first step.
